channel.title: Ict homework XD in exel
channel.description:
right i am doing the ict gnvq course and i need to do a spreadsheet in exel but i dont know how to put drop down bars on it and how to make it so that when you select the item in the drop down bar it inserts a number into a diffrent cell.
so say like i was making one for a resturant and was selling drinks in the drop down bar for drink it would be wine, coke ect so you select the drink and it puts the price into the cell next to it. hope it makes sense thanks for reading ;)[br][size=1]Posted at: May 15, 2006, 03:43:03 pm[/size][hr]i woulda fought this would be easy seing as this is a forum about ict things :P or does what i asked not make sense?

item.title: Ict homework XD in exel
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:11, topic:2970”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=3225.msg35804#msg35804 date=1148318588]
uugh, i finished my gnvq course with an A (distinction)

i made mine entirely in vba using excel!

they said i didnt need to go into tat much detail, so i had to restart it and use the cells with simple forumula (WTF?? DUMBASSES)
[/quote]

Lol, they should have given you extra credit then for going into such detail and going above and beyond the requirements :)[/quote]

exactly should have
it took me about a week to make it, then my teacher said no its wrong and i have 2 weeks to catch up.
i did it all in 1 lesson rofl, still got an A. so was allowed to play games for the other 2 weeks - 1 lesson

Read full topic

item.title: Ict homework XD in exel
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Once you create the combo box in your excel document or a form, right click and say Format Control. Click on the icon next to the Input Range box and then just select the cells that will be used for options in the combo box.

Next part is tricky. You can either use VBA code to determine the value of the combobox and print a price value in a different cell, or you can create an intricate conditional function in a cell. I’m not very experienced with vba or managing forms in excel, so I would look in your book to see how they manipulate form elements.

Read full topic

item.title: Ict homework XD in exel
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

VBA stands for Visual Basic for Applications. It’s basically VB structured code modified for coding macros and such for applications like excel. Using VBA the only way I can think of solving your problem…unless I misunderstood it.

item.title: Ict homework XD in exel
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Do you mean a dropdown bar when working with forms and vba in excel?

I haven’t done this kind of stuff in excel for a while, but I think when you create the combo box, and select the input range (which will give the values in the dropdown box), you need to load up the vba editor to give it the necessary code. Now, I don’t know if there’s an easier way, but I would obtain the selected value/index of the combo box and determine through the vba code in your subroutine what to input in a specific cell, which would be like:

Range("A1").Select
Selection.Value = 1.99

Or something…hope that help at least a bit.

Read full topic
